text: a vietnamese everyday family meal would
not be complete without a hot bowl of
soup in this video i will share with you
three easy and delicious sweet and sour
soup recipe that are not only nutritious
but also very tasty let's begin
the first recipe is the sweet and sour
fish soup but not the southern style
that you might have heard of this one is
much more simple to cook using pickled
bamboo shoot in central vietnamese style
you will need one snack catfish one cup
of pickled bamboo shoot some rice
battery herbs fresh chilies and natto
seeds bring 1.5 litres of water to a
boil and a teaspoon of salt add snack
head fish sticks bring to a boil again
then add the pickled bamboo shoot would
i have rings and squeeze out the excess
water you can add some tomato wedges to
add more color and flavor season to
taste with two teaspoons of stock powder
a teaspoon of sugar a dash of anato or
chili oil to make the soup look more
tempting finally garnish with some
chopped rice patty herbs it's so simple
and easy but you're gonna be amazed how
the flavors of the pickled bamboo shoot
can bring to the soup it's so fresh with
the my sweet and sour taste with very
unique flavors and textures second
recipe is baby squid with pickle
muttered green soup
you will need 200 gram of baby squids a
cup of pickled mutton greens some garlic
ginger scallion and tomato cut the
pickled mutton greens in shorter lengths
cut the tomato into wedges remove the
quill and the innards of the baby squids
in a pot saute some minced garlic until
fragrant then add the tomatoes add a
dash of fish sauce then cook and stir
for about a minute then add the baby
squids and stir well add 1 liter of
boiling water also add the pickled
mutton greens add a piece of smell
ginger and a teaspoon of sugar to
balance out the sourness of the pico
mustard greens cook for another minute
or two and take off the heat the sweet
and sour taste of the pickled mustard
greens combined with a sweet and tender
squid what a great soup especially for
those hot summer days one more unique
sweet and sour vietnamese soup that you
might not have heard of or tried if you
have not been to vietnam that is kentu
la yang or swin sour river leaf soup la
yang is native to indochina it can be
used as a medicine or as a food with its
natural sour taste la yang is now used
very popularly in vietnamese cuisine you
can eat them fresh or cooked they pair
perfectly with chicken in soup or hot
pot you will need 300 gram of chicken
leg a bunch of la yang some garlic and
fresh chilies rub the chicken with some
salt rinse well and chop into bite-size
pieces season with a teaspoon of stock
powder a teaspoon of sugar half a
teaspoon of salt and a dash of pepper
mix well and set aside for about 15
minutes next in the saucepan saute some
minced garlic into the fragrance then
add the marinated chicken and cook until
no longer pink add one to one and a half
liters of water and bring to a boil
detach the leaves of la yang from the
stems we only eat the green leafy pot
because the stem and the branches are
too fibrous and hard to eat
rinse well and use your hands to rub the
leaves so as to release the natural
sourness
then add to the soup and bring back to a
boil again season with some fish sauce
and stock powder to taste add a few
chops fresh chilies and your nutritious
and tasty soup is ready so which version
of the vietnamese sweden style soup is
your favorite let me know in the comment
section below also don't forget to click
like and subscribe to my channel for
more amazing vietnamese recipes i will
see you then next time bye
[Music]
you
